metadata.title: The cyclophilin-inhibitor alisporivir stimulates antigen presentation thereby promoting antigen-specific CD8 + T cell activation

body_text.text: then transferred into a puromycin selectable lentiviral vector pWPI_puro (pWPI_NS5BEM_puro) supporting continuous expression under control of a constitutive promoter (EF1α). Cloning of HLA-A*02 into the pWPI backbone has been described previously [7] . Gaussia-Luciferase (GLuc) expression plasmid pcDNA3.1_GLuc was a kind gift of Margarita Zayas (Department of Infectious Diseases, Molecular Virology, Heidelberg).
description of the procedure is included in a previous work [8] .
body_text.section: Generation of Lentiviral Particles and Generation of Stable Cell Lines. A detailed

body_text.text: HepG2_NS5BEM_puro, Huh6.1_NS5BEM_puro and Huh7_Lunet HLA-A*02_puro cells were kept in culture with 1µg/ml puromycin (Sigma Aldrich), to ensure stable expression of transgenes. Alisporivir co) were then shifted to 37°C to let internalization occur or kept on ice during the whole experiment. MHC-I or b2m endocytosis was stopped by moving cells to 4°C. Surface-bound antibody was monitored by staining with a secondary antibody (goat-anti-mouse PE) for 30min at 4°C. Cells were washed twice with icecold PBS and analyzed by flow cytometry. The half-life (t1/2) of b2m on the cell surface was calculated by one-phase decay using GraphPad Prism version 5.03 for Windows (GraphPad Software, CA). This protocol was modified from a previous publication [9] .

FIGREF0.text: (GLuc) Secretion. 2x10^5 Huh6.1 cells were seeded per well of a 12-well dish. The next day cells were transfected with 1µg pcDNA3.1_GLuc per well or the empty vector control using transIT-LT1 transfection reagent (Mirus Bio, Madison, WI) following the instructions of the manufacturer. 12h post transfection 100µl of supernatant (SN) as well as the cell lysate were collected and stored at -20°C (0h timepoint). The residual wells were washed twice with PBS and fresh DMEM or DMEM containing DMSO, Alisporivir (4µM) or the protein transport inhibitor Brefeldin A (dilution 1:1000; BD biosciences) was added. After treatment, supernatants and cell lysates were harvested every 12h until 48h post transfection (resembling 36h post treatment

FIGREF1.text: Blotting. Cells were lysed in a modified radioimmunoprecipitation (RIPA) buffer (150 mM NaCl, 0.1% Triton X-100, 0.5% sodium deoxycholate, 0.1% SDS (sodium dodecyl sulphate), 50 mM Tris-HCl (pH 8.0), protease inhibitor cocktail from Roche). Proteins were separated by 10% SDS-PAGE and blotted on nitrocellulose membranes (Amersham, GE Healthcare, Freiburg, Germany). Membranes were incubated with primary antibodies directed against β-actin (Sigma Aldrich), HLA-A (abcam), calnexin (Enzo Life Sciences, Lörrach, Germany), ARTS1 (ERAP1) (abcam) followed by incubation with horseradish peroxidase (HRP) coupled secondary antibodies (Sigma-Aldrich, Steinheim, Germany). For detection Western Lightning Plus ECL reagent (Perkin Elmer, Waltham, MA, USA) was applied to the membranes and chemiluminescent signals were captured using a ChemoCam Imager (Intas Science Imaging, Göttingen, Germany). Signal intensities were quantified with Quantity One 1-D analysis software (version 4.6.2, BioRad, Hercules, CA, USA).

FIGREF2.text: HepG2 cells induce maximal T-cell activation. (A) HLA-A2 surface expression of HepG2 and Huh6.1 cells. Depicted is one representative experiment (n=2). (B) HepG2 cells expressing NS5BEM were cocultured at an E:T ratio of 1:1 with a HLA-A*02 restricted and NS5BEM specific T-cell clone. HepG2 cells not expressing the recognized antigen (no NS5B, negative control) or stimulated with IFN-γ (stimulation of antigen presentation) served as controls. 5h after coculture surface CD8 expression and intracellular IFNγ production were measured. Supplementary Fig. 2: Alisporivir enhances MHC-I surface expression on a panel of human hepatoma cell lines. (A) Huh6.1, HepaRG or Huh7_Lunet cells were treated with DMSO, Alisporivir (4µM) or IFN-γ (10ng/ml). 48h later surface MHC-I was monitored using a HLA-A, B, C specific antibody (W6/32) and goat-antimouse PE secondary antibody. Data are derived from one representative experiment and depicted as histograms (left) (n=2). (B) Mean fold change and SD of GeoMFIs of two (Huh7_Lunet, HepaRG) or three (Huh6.1) independent experiments normalized to DMSO control. For statistical analysis paired t-test was performed. (C) The indicated cell lines of non-hepatic origin were treated and analyzed as described in (A). Depicted is one representative experiment. (D) Mean fold change and SD of GeoMFIs of two (5637, CaCo2) or three (HEK 293T, HeLa, LS180, A549) independent experiments. For statistical analysis paired t-test was performed. Supplementary Fig. 3: Alisporivir does not affect b2m mRNA levels or transferrin receptor (TFR) recycling over time. (A) Huh6.1 cells were treated with DMSO, Alisporivir (4µM) or IFN-γ (10ng/ml) for the indicated times. b2m transcript levels were measured by quantitative PCR and normalized to GAPDH and untreated control. Shown are mean and SD derived from one measurement performed in triplicates. (B) TFR recycling was determined by feeding Huh6.1 cells with Alexa-488 coupled transferrin, followed by incubation at 37°C (recycling) for different times. Recycling was stopped by moving cells to 4°C. Fluorescence intensity was measured by flow cytometry. The degree of TFR recycling was expressed as GeoMFI t0 -GeoMFI tx with GeoMFI t0 representing the signal in absence of recycling (4°C) and GeoMFI tx representing the signal for different incubation times at 37°C. Data are derived from one representative experiment (n=2). (C) b2m internalization over time in Huh6.1 cells. The experiment was performed as described in legend of figure 4F but using a b2m-specific antibody. GeoMFIs were plotted against time (min) to monitor internalization. Half-life (t1/2) of surface b2m was calculated with one phase decay using GraphPad Prism 5 software. Note the higher b2m surface expression at T0 upon Alisporivir pre-treatment. Data are derived from one experiment (n=1). (D) Analysis of MHC-I trafficking dynamics with pulse chase. After starvation, HepaRG cells were pulse-labelled for 60min (C) with 10µCi of [ 35 S]-methionine/cysteine and chased for the indicated times. Upon cell lysis and MHC-I immunoprecipitation with W6/32 antibody, the samples were digested with EndoH as indicated and separated by SDS-PAGE. Peptide-N-glycosidase F (PNGaseF) and Brefeldin A (BFA) treatment served as controls for detection of digested MHC-I. Alisporivir was applied 22h before starvation and continuously during the experiment. (E) Analysis of MHC-I trafficking dynamics with pulse chase. The experiment was performed as described for (D) with the following modifications: HepaRG cells were labelled for 30min with 20µCi of [ 35 S]-methionine/cysteine and chased for the indicated times. EndoH r , EndoH resistant MHC-I fraction; EndoH s , EndoH sensitive MHC-I fraction Supplementary Fig. 5: Cyclophilin-inhibitors and analogs thereof promote an upregulation of HLA-A*02 surface expression. (A) and (B) Cyp-inhibitors enhance MHC-I surface expression. The experiment was performed using identical experimental settings as described in Figure 6D but using a MHC-I-specific W6/32 antibody. Piperine was applied with 50µM. Data are derived from one experiment (n=1) which served to confirm previous observations for HLA-A*02 surface expression. Dark shaded area, goat-anti-mouse-PE secondary antibody. (B) Depicted are GeoMFIs derived from (A). (C) Proliferation of Huh6.1 cells upon treatment with different inhibitors at the indicated concentrations for 48h as determined by WST-1 cell proliferation reagent (Roche). Data are derived from triplicates of one representative experiment and normalized to the untreated control (n=2).Supplementary

TABREF0.text: ). For determination of GLuc activity, 5µl of supernatant or cell lysate were added to 100µl of PBS containing 0.7µg/ml Coelenterazine (PJK GmbH, Kleinblittersdorf, Germany). Luminescence was measured in a Lumat LB 9507 tube reader (Berthold Technologies, Bad Wildbad, Germany). Data were normalized to the 0h value, at which cells were treated with DMSO, Alisporivir (4µM) or Brefeldin A. Internalization Assay. 3x10^5 Huh6.1 cells were seeded on a 12-well dish. 4h later samples were treated either with DMSO or 4µM of Alisporivir. 48h after treatment, cells were detached with Accutase (ThermoFisher Scientific, Darmstadt, Germany), transferred to reaction tubes and incubated together with 1µg/ml of primary antibodies (anti-β2 microglobulin or anti-HLA-A, B, C; W6/32 antibody) for 30min at 4°C. After washing the samples in a large volume of ice-cold PBS, cells were resuspended in PBS 3%BSA containing DMSO or Alisporivir (4µM). Alisporivir was either added to cells which were preincubated with Alisporivir (Alisporivir 48h pre) or to previously untreated cells (Alisporivir co). Samples (DMSO, Alisporivir 48h pre,

TABREF1.text: Primer sequences were: S_GAPDH GAAGGTGAAGGTCGGAGTC and A_GAPDH FCS for 45min at 37°C. Then cells were labeled for 1h at 37°C by replacing the supernatant by DMEM without FCS containing 20µg/ml Alexa 488-transferrin (Alexa 488-Tf; ThermoFisher Scientific, Darmstadt, Germany). After labeling, surface bound Alexa 488-Tf was removed by short acidic treatment with PBS (pH 5.0) followed by a wash with PBS (pH 7.0). To follow TFR recycling, pre-warmed DMEM containing 10% FCS was added to the samples, which were then incubated at 37°C for different periods of time (chase, tx). TFR recycling was stopped by shifting cells to 4°C. One plate was incubated at 4°C during the whole experiment and treated with acidic PBS after harvesting all samples to measure maximal signal intensity (pulse control, t0).After collecting all samples at 4°C, cells were detached with trypsin/EDTA, fixed with PBS containing 1% paraformaldehyde (Sigma Aldrich) and analyzed by flow cytometry. The degree of TFR recycling was calculated by substracting the signal measured over time at 37°C (GeoMFI tx) from the pulse signal (GeoMFI t0).Radiolabeling, MHC-I immunoprecipitation and Endoglycosidase H digestion.3x10^5 HepaRG cells were seeded on 6-well dishes, treated for 22h with DMSO or Alisporivir followed by starvation for 1h at 37°C with methionine-and cysteine-free medium. Then 10µCi [ 35 S]-methionine/cysteine were added to the starvation medium.After incubation for 60min at 37°C, cells were washed with PBS and medium containing Alisporivir or DMSO was added to the cells. TABREF2.text: Expression of cytokine receptors on human hepatomacell lines Huh6 and Huh7 compared to non-transformed liver cells.absent, + present, +/-very low expression, n.a.: no information available at the time of analysis, (IL, interleukin; TNFRSF, tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily; TGF, transforming growth factor; IFN, interferon); Transcriptome data for Huh6.1 founder cells and Huh7 cells have been published before[8] and are accessible via GEO accession number GSE68927.Table 2: Peptidyl prolyl isomerase expression in Huh6.1 and Huh7 cells.(A) absent, (P) present, (M) medium expressed; Transcriptome data for Huh6.1 founder cells and Huh7 cells have been published before[8] and are accessible via GEO accession number GSE68927.
